description:
Are you looking to take control of your own destiny?

If you’re an achiever, you need to read this!

Our Business
 

MyCorp Corporation is a market leading independent office automation and IT vendor which has been serving our customers for more than a quarter of a century. Managed print services are at the heart of our business, but supplying and supporting products and solutions that enable improved outcomes, is what we are really all about. We specialise in offering our existing and new clients a broad range of industry leading products from the world’s biggest brands. Because we operate independently of any manufacturer, we are able to offer the best possible solutions to our clients and then provide ongoing support via our technical services arm. We have a large and broad customer base which we have been successfully growing for the last 25 years.
 

The Role
 

The role of Account Executive is all about uncovering and converting new opportunities into sales.  This involves the key task of sourcing new prospects and then successfully selling them products and services from our broad range of offerings. The role therefore requires someone that has the skills to not only prospect effectively, but also manage the end to end sales process. It is vitally important that you have the ability to comprehend the technical concepts of a broad range of products and services.

As a result there is a significant requirement for a highly defined level of verbal and written communication, comprehension and problem solving skills.

In addition to securing new business, there is also the ongoing account management of your allocated customer base.

All successfully converted sales are rewarded by a generous bonus scheme which is open ended and performance based. This is paid in addition to a competitive basic salary. We expect successful applicants to be earning in excess of £60K within the first year.
 

The Person
 

As we are a progressive and successful company we are looking for individuals that fit this mould. In order to be considered for the role, you must be able to demonstrate the following characteristics & experiences;

  • Previous successful experience within a B2B sales role, including all that it encompasses
  • Be highly self disciplined and motivated to  achieve successful outcomes
  • An effective communicator and influencer
  • A team player
  • Commercially aware and astute
  • Adaptable and confident
  • Have the ability to think outside of the box
  • Have personal pride and a desire to achieve the set objectives
  • Possess the ability to work to deadlines and targets


If you think that you have what it takes, please apply online by submitting your CV along with a covering letter, highlighting why you should be considered for the role.

title: CRM and Data Analyst
shortDescription: A vacancy exists for a CRM and Data Analyst to maintain and evolve an effective Customer relationship, prospect development and sales cycle management system and to ensure the compliance of the data handling within MyCorp’s information handling systems.
description:
Profile

The successful candidate will be a highly motivated and accountable individual able to work under his/her own initiative and possessing good technical and analytical skills. Excellent listening and communication skills are essential.

He or she will have extensive knowledge of Frontrange Goldmine or similar application and ideally administrator level knowledge of Microsoft SQL Server 2000. Candidates should also have knowledge of data compliance and data management matters.

The role will primarily be based in our Head Office in Horsham but will require expensed travel to our regional offices currently in London, Kent and Hampshire.

Responsibilities

Overview
Goldmine - Responsibility for the maintenance and development of the Goldmine system and procedures in accordance with the requirements of the marketing, telemarketing, telesales, sales and Customer Relationship Management activities of the MyCorp group of companies
Compliance - Responsibility for Data compliance, including but not limited to the Data Protection Act and Telemarketing Regulations.

Product data management - Responsibility for the timely updating and currency of all web based product data and development and maintenance of electronic product data set.

IT - Responsibility to assist, as necessary, with internal IT tasks
 

Specific

To understand and commit to the principles of accountability as defined in the "OZ Principle.

To comply with, promote and ensure adherence to Health and Safety policies as issued from time to time.

To comply with, promote and ensure adherence with all relevant Work Instructions, Procedures, Standards and Codes of Conduct as issued from time to time.

Goldmine responsibilities to include day to day system and DB maintenance
1.	Backup of Goldmine DB
2.	Training of operators – induction and ongoing
3.	Reporting as requested by the Management and Board
4.	Development of system in accordance with the company"s requirements
Compliance - Responsibility for Data compliance, including but not limited to the Data Protection Act and Telemarketing Regulations. To include:
•	Maintain knowledge currency on relevant regulations
•	Issue and management of group data protection statement/s
•	Ensure MyCorp’s activities remain compliant
•	Ensure MyCorp’s web site remain compliant
•	Advice to the MyCorp Board in respect of group data compliance including advice on CBS data management etc.
•	Registration and maintenance of relevant approval and standards
Product data management - Responsibility for the timely updating and currency of all web based product data. To include:
•	Obtaining, formatting and publishing product data to web site
•	Development of electronic product data set
•	Removal of obsolete product data
•	Attendance at web site review meetings when required
IT - Responsibility to assist as necessary with limited internal IT tasks

To develop and maintain training activities necessary to ensure the level of operators is at the required level at all times.

To maintain accurate documentation for all areas of responsibility.

LOOKING TO BREAK INTO A CAREER IN SALES & MARKETING

Are you a confident communicator looking to work for an organisation who value their employees and offer excellent career progression and rewards? 

We are building a vibrant team of Telemarketing Executives, paying £14K with OTE circa £20K, within our Horsham head office.

The role of the Telemarketing Executives is to market company products within an outbound telephone environment. You will work within a structured environment supported by a comprehensive telephone & IT platform allowing you to focus on the challenges of communicating business solutions to existing customers and prospects. Working closely with our on-the-road sales force you will create qualified opportunities for face to face meetings across a wide and exciting range of business products.

You will need to be energetic, confident, enthusiastic, open minded, committed and passionate about making money. 

You should be competitive, self motivated, focused to set your own goals and success orientated. 

Your communication skills must be good but we will work with you to develop them further, providing ongoing training and the necessary skills, tools and motivation to meet your targets.

You must be reliable, resilient and used to/willing to work in a highly targeted environment. You must have basic PC Skills.

MyCorp has evolved over the last twenty years to provide customers with a broad range of technologies & services, which can be seamlessly integrated to provide genuine solutions for today’s working environments. The overriding mission is to be a strategic partner to customers providing them with the skills and vision to support their business requirements - short, medium and long term. This mission is underwritten by a philosophy of accountability ensuring quality in our provision of integrated technologies and services.  
  
The MyCorp group now employs 140 people from three locations, across 5 business areas: business equipment which looks at all aspects of print, copying and communication, business infrastructure from hardware, software and connectivity to security, cabling which designs and installs voice, data and power cabling, supplies & consumables catering for the aftermarket, and Cameron Barclay, which provides project and workspace management solutions.

The database/Goldmine Administrator reports to the IT Manager.

The administrator oversees the daily operation of the various databases at the multiple office locations.  There are multiple databases providing several business critical functions to the company and are required to be available at all times.

The administrator is responsible for ensuring the accuracy and integrity of the databases, including input and output, reporting and end user training.

The position will provide support to the company by developing required reports, ensuring staff are trained on the proper use of the database, developing and implementing polices to guide data entry and to ensure that the database generates accurate analytical reports.

This position will be the first point of contact for company staff with questions or problems with the use of the database and will serve as liaison to suppliers in maintaining the hardware and software troubleshooting problems.

  • SQL Server 2005, 2008, 2012
  • SSIS Deployment
  • TSQL (views, functions)
  • Goldmine CRM experience
  • Goldbox
  • Good written and verbal communication skills
  • Comfortable communicating technical concepts to peers, groups or executives
  • Stored procedures creation

 

 

Desired Requirements

  • Visual studio programming
  • HTML coding skills
  • Microsoft certification for database administration would be advantageous

 

 

Responsibilities

 

  • Maintaining integrity of databases
  • Establish and maintain backup and recovery policies and procedures
  • Integration of 3rd party systems into SQL database
  • Maintain multiple office location databases synching to head office
  • Provide required reporting and analytical information from databases
  • Interface price feeds and other data feeds into databases
  • Publish data to website
  • Provide data entry screens for end users to update database
  • Provide full documentation on all databases
  • Maintain up to date software versions of all software
  • First line of support for all users of the databases
  • Assist/cover for general IT skills when holiday cover required
  • Monitor performance of databases that support the company
